questions.question: What is the main problem?
questions.help: You can only pick one answer.
answers: I have a rash, spots, red or flaky skin or blisters
I have lumps on my skin
I bruise easily and for no reason

questions.question: Is the rash made up of blisters?
questions.help: Blisters are small pockets of clear fluid under a layer of skin.

questions.question: Are you so ill that you've stopped doing all of your usual daily activities?
questions.help: We are checking to see if you feel so ill that you can't do anything you usually would, such as watch tv, use your phone, read or get out of bed.
answers: Yes - I've stopped doing everything I usually do
I feel ill but can do some of my usual activities
No - I feel well enough to do most of my usual daily activities

questions.question: Do you know how the problem was caused?
answers: It was the result of a sexual assault
It was a deliberate serious assault or a child has been hurt on purpose by an adult
It was a deliberate assault which caused scrapes, bruises or scratches
I'm not sure or it was something else

questions.question: Have you got more than 3 blisters or ulcers in your mouth or throat?
Is your skin peeling off in large pieces like you have very bad sunburn?
Is there a large area of skin that looks like it's been burned all over?
questions.help: For example, your whole leg, arm, head, face, or most of your chest or tummy.

questions.question: Do you have new blisters around your eye?
Has a doctor told you that getting an infection might be very serious?
questions.help: This means you have a condition that weakens your immune system. For example having chemotherapy, had an organ transplant, have HIV/AIDS or had your spleen removed.
